intro: Anacampseros schmidtii, commonly known as the Schmidt's ice plant, is a succulent plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, which includes many species adapted to arid environments. The plant has fleshy, ribbed leaves that store water, allowing it to survive in dry conditions. It produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and orange during the warm season. This species is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and low maintenance requirements.
